cab.content:
Col. Jones
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
?T.2923
From : British Military Attache, Petrograd.
To : D.M.I.
5th December 1917.
1550.
Generals Manikovski and Marusshevski have not yet been released. It is expected General *Potapov will be placed at head of Ministry of War. He has not much character and was ten years Military Attache, Cettinge. No information is believed to have been received yet of the progress of the negotiations and +Smolni feels uncomfortable. The western front has put up its own scheme for armistice December 1st two months. German units to remain where they are. Have we thought out our policy if the Bolshevicks still remain in power after Constituent Assembly meets?
* Q.M.G. at Petrograd.
+ The part of Petrograd where are the Head Quarters of the Bolshevicks.
